snippet: The debt load of Grupo A.C.S., a giant construction company based in Spain, reflects the country’s severe financial struggle.
abstract: Debt load of Grupo ACS, a giant construction company based in Spain, reflects the country’s severe financial struggle; it is frantically selling off assets and paying down 9 billion euros ($11.7 billion) in debt, twice the firm's shrinking market value; economists say one of the greatest threats to the country could well be the snarl of debt choking off the growth prospects of ACS and other highly indebted Spanish companies, resulting in economic stagnation.
lead_paragraph: The debt load of Grupo A.C.S., a giant construction company based in Spain, reflects the country’s severe financial struggle.

headline.seo: In Spain, Grupo A.C.S.’s High Debt Reflects Country’s Finances
headline.main: In Spain, a Debt Crisis Built on Corporate Borrowing
headline.print_headline: In Spain, a Debt Crisis Built on Corporate Borrowing
